summary: This document is a chain of internal FBI emails from June-July 2020 discussing the need for volunteer assistance to conduct a 'taint review' in connection with the Jeffrey Epstein case. The emails are between FBI Special Agents in New York (NY) and another field office (TD), coordinating logistics for the review.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.role: FBI Special Agent, New York Field Office, Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking
persons.context: The primary FBI agent in New York requesting and coordinating assistance for a taint review related to the Epstein case. They are the case agent for the investigation.

connections.description: FBI colleagues coordinating work on the Epstein case, with SA volunteering to assist Special Agent's team with a taint review.

events.title: Initial request for taint review assistance
events.description: An FBI Special Agent in New York sends an email requesting assistance for a taint review in connection with the Jeffrey Epstein case.

events.title: Volunteer offer for taint review
events.description: SA from the TD field office emails to volunteer assistance for the Epstein case taint review.

events.title: Coordination for training and meeting
events.description: SA and Special Agent coordinate meeting at '26 fed' (likely 26 Federal Plaza, FBI NY office) for training and to discuss the taint review.

locations: 290 (likely referring to 290 Broadway, a federal building in NYC)
26 fed (likely referring to 26 Federal Plaza, FBI New York Field Office)
9th floor (of an unspecified building, likely 26 Federal Plaza)
keyFacts: The FBI was actively conducting a 'taint review' in connection with the Jeffrey Epstein case as of June-July 2020.
The review was being handled by the Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking squad in the New York Field Office.
The case was described as a 'high profile investigation' and a 'unique opportunity' for agents.
The emails show internal FBI coordination and resource allocation for the Epstein investigation.
Access to a 'CAIR account' on the 'high side' (likely classified system) was part of the setup for agents working on the review.
